comment: I personally found this course to be very boring and highly theoretical, with very little applicable knowledge. However, that is not a fault of Professor Hill, who provided detailed lectures and was kind and quick to respond to inquiries. I highly recommend practicing the math and taking notes on conceptual questions for best success.

Pretty straight forward professor. Her tests aren't too difficult for the most part. Being prepared is an important step to doing good on the tests. There's even bonus points for the 1st test. She can be strict on lab values, but just ask her if your lab values are good. 
Keeping up with lectures is crucial, use either the videos or pdfs.

Did a really good job of explaining things verbally, not as much visually. You can easily get a B on exams without studying. Having a final project and final exam is annoying but they're not too bad. If you're just looking for the easy grade and don't really care about learning the theory, take her.
Very straightforward online professor for Engr. Ethics. Grades are based on short quizzes, homeworks, and a final group paper. Very lenient grader all-around.

Very straightforward lectures that translate directly to what's on the exams. Usually easy to follow (but tedious) labs. Responds very quickly and is quite helpful. There is a lack of provided practice content which can make it hard to learn things properly but you're allowed formula sheets for exams so it's not too bad

Her electronics class was probably the most organized class I've taken at KSU. Course is broken up weekly with lecture videos that give you the concepts and some examples - no fluff. Labs were straightforward and Prof. Hill would help if needed. She really cares about seeing you succeed. Exams and Final are in Lockdown, but you get a formula sheet.

The GOAT for all non EE majors. Even if you struggle with circuits material she presents the information in a way that is very easy to digest and apply through her online lectures. She gives you all the resources you need and also gives great instruction and feedback in lab. Take her, she is the best 3401 instructor by far!

This class seemed like a boring topic but Prof Hill made it fun and easy. I definitely recommend her. There is some reading, but the quizzes are open book/notes and the reading can be comprehended well enough to pass with just a skim. The assignments were on interesting topics and never took more than an hour to do.

Professor Hill is one of the better professors I have had at KSU. Her pre-recorded lectures are easy to understand. Quizzes and Exams are very closely related to the text and her lectures. Small group discussion posts which are simple. Final paper was easy as long as you provide the info she's looking for. Would recommend her for Ethics.

Professor Hill was always very nice and helpful when it came to answering questions, even responding on the weekends with screenshots of information and equations I needed. My biggest complaint would just come from trying to put so much information into a shortened semester. Definitely take 3401 during a full semester if possible.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: If you have the opportunity to take Sheila hill for EE 2305, take her. She understands ME majors don't particularly enjoy Circuits, she breaks it down and makes it easy for us to understand. Only Labs were in-person and all the lectures were able to be watched on your own time. Final can be exempted, gives bonus pts but know how to do HW questions.

Compared to other EE professors in general, she is great. Class was hybrid, so lectures were online but still okay. Tests are proctored, but her lectures correlate to exam materials. She also lets you have formula sheets, so they help. Quizzes are also unlimited time until due so you can go and ask her for help. Easily accessible.

Class is taught through prerecorded lectures videos. Tests were proctored but werent hard. The homework/participation assignments were helpful to understanding tests. Honestly, I have not much to say about the professor the class was asynchronous but the class was not bad to take. Would take her for another EE class in-person if given the chance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Take Prof Hill! Her online class is very easy to follow, with entertaining lectures (hint: play the lectures on 1.5x speed). Each week there is a homework with 10 questions, and there are three exams and a cumulative final. As an ME major, electronics are not my thing, but Sheila made the subject matter interesting and easy to understand.

Prof. Hill was great for EE 2305! The way that she explains things is simple and uncomplicated. The entire course was well organized and well paced. If you simply complete everything in order you should have no trouble getting an A. The exams are very close to the homework and videos. She was also extremely helpful in the lab. Gives extra credit.

She usually posts two weekly lecture vides that are about 10-15 min each. These videos are very well organized and she does examples as well. The Homework and Practice Tests are very similar to the actual exams. She's an excellent teacher and I would highly recommend her.

Professor Hill is one of the best at KSU in my opinion. Her online class for circuits had a very clear and concise flow to it. Her lectures are clear, and she does many examples to clarify. The homework really helps you to prepare for the final exam. An average on all 3 tests, then no final. I would take another class of hers in a heartbeat.
Easy class, caring prof, nothing special to see here. Wouldn't recommend taking if you have a genuine interest in the material.

She teaches the hybrid class watch the lecture videos and you will get an easy A+ test are very similar to homework and she gives study guides. If you EE major take her for everything you can if youre ME take her for 2305 you wont regret it!

You will not learn much by just attending class, you will have to apply yourself if you really want to learn the material (which is very useful!). However, you will get an easy grade. Minimal effort short result in an A, especially if you have previous exams and she doesn't change the problems much, such as my case. Kind of a dis-service tbh

I just finished spring 2020 with Prof. Hill and let me say she is an amazing teacher! So good I considered switching my major to EE just to take more classes with her. EE2305 is a hybrid class with a lab, just watch her videos and take notes and you will get an A

She is a good professor in the sense you will most likely get an easy grade, however you aren't going to learn much unless you force yourself to do extra. I didn't find myself really understanding the theory from her lectures, merely how to plug and chug, which isn't engineering. Maybe she doesn't want much trouble to just keep her job? who nows
Hill was undoubtedly the best professor to have Electronics with! Very fair grader, lectures aren't fluffy (they contain what you need to know) and she is knowledgeable.

Hill is overall a great professor. Her lectures cover the material and the tests are straight from the HW. She lets you exempt the final if you have an A, which is great during finals week. Also, she gives bonus quizzes which are super easy and add 5ish points on your final grade. Overall, easy A and you will learn the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Hill is by far the best professor I have had here at KSU. If you come to class and/or watch the blackboard lectures, you honestly shouldnt leave that class with anything less than an A.

Best professor I ever had. Electronics is one of the toughest topics to understand regardless of what Prof. you have, but Prof. Hill breaks down the topics in a simpler way with her slides and lectures that she posts online. Highly recommend her. Make sure you take full advantage of your homework, labs, and bonus too.

Can't say enough good things about this girl. She is a hidden gem in the EE department. The reason I give her 4 stars is because I basically taught myself the material, I did not learn that well from her lectures.

She's really nice, but she doesn't teach very well. She puts videos of her lectures on D2L, but in class she barely spends 30 minutes teaching material, she just zooms by and assumes we'll go back to the videos to relearn everything. So it is nice to be able to view the lectures again, but it seems like going to class is a waste of time.

Took her Fall 2018. Has very fair tests and she is very understanding. There was 7 hws (one is dropped), 3 tests, 9 labs, and a final ( it can be exempt if you have an A average in the class). Extra credit is offered for the tests (30 points total). Just go to class, practice, do the hw, and you be fine.

Best part is that you don't have to go to class since she posts her lectures online. You can watch the lecture live. Tests are ok, not too hard, just study and actually do the homework and the test is cake. Shes an awesome teacher and very fair grader.
Great choice! Shes really helpful and easy to approach
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I cannot say enough about thus professor, she is wonderful. She teaches well, and is ready to answer any questions. She WANTS EVERYONE to do GREAT so she grades very lenient and fair. She posts everything on D2l so it is okay if you miss class. Her reviews are extremely relevant to the tests. She lets you exempt the final if you do well!

Took Semiconductors with Mrs. Hill and she was very informative and knowledgable on the subject. Semiconductor physics is a very confusing and abstract subject that she taught well. She also recorded all her lectures for students who couldn't make it to class. She has a humorous personality which is pleasing as a student.

Great Professor and pretty cool person. Semi is a lot, but she did a great job of breaking everything down. And her tests were reflective of class and homework material. Study, do homework, and you'll do decent!

She is a great professor and deserves credit for it. Semiconductors isn't an easy class but she did a great job explaining everything as she is very knowledgeable on the subject. If I have a chance to take her in the future she would be my first choice.

She is a goodShe teaches very well and helps people understand the concepts. However there is alot of busy work to do such as the homework, group assignments, and the labs. There are 4 tests and a final. The final can be exempt if you get a 88 or higher test average along with doing all of the work. Just put the work in and you will be good.
